text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Maximum speed limit with traffic calming
options.B: Only 20 cars allowed at any one time
options.D: Minimum speed limit with traffic calming

explanation: Maximum speed limit with traffic calming. The 20 mph zone sign indicates a maximum speed limit in an area with traffic calming measures.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: End of 20 mph zone. This sign marks the end of a 20 mph speed limit zone.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Clearway (no stopping). A clearway sign means no stopping at any time except in an emergency.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: No through road. This sign indicates the road ahead doesn't continue through to another road.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: No right turn. This sign prohibits turning right at the junction.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Route for buses only. This indicates a road or lane reserved exclusively for bus use.

text:
Which type of vehicle
does this sign apply to?
explanation: High vehicles. This sign warns that height restrictions apply ahead.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Two-way traffic. This warns that you're entering a road with traffic flowing in both directions.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Clearway (no stopping). Red lines or clearway signs mean no stopping at any time.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: End of restricted parking area. This marks the end of a controlled parking zone.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: No overtaking. This sign prohibits overtaking in this section.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Priority over oncoming vehicles. You have priority when this sign is shown.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Vehicles may park on the right-hand side of the road only
options.B: Vehicles may park fully on the verge or footway
options.C: Vehicles may not park on the verge or footway
options.D: Vehicles may park on the left-hand side of the road only

explanation: 30 mph speed limit. This shows the maximum permitted speed is 30 mph.

text:
What does this traffic
sign mean?
explanation: End of dual carriageway. This warns that the dual carriageway is ending ahead.

text:
What's the meaning of
this traffic sign?

options.B: Give priority to vehicles coming towards you
options.D: You have priority over vehicles coming towards you

explanation: School crossing patrol ahead. This warns of a school crossing patrol operating ahead.

text:
In winter, road signs can
become covered by snow.
What does this sign mean?
explanation: T-junction ahead. This warns that the road ahead ends at a T-junction.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Roundabout ahead. This sign gives advance warning of a roundabout.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.B: Approaching traffic passes you on both sides
options.C: Turn off at the next available junction
options.D: Pass either side to get to the same destination

explanation: Traffic signals ahead. This warns of traffic lights ahead.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Uneven road ahead. This warns of bumps or dips in the road surface.

text:
What messages are
given by circular traffic
signs that have a blue
background?

options.A: They give directions to car parks
options.D: They give temporary directions during a diversion

explanation: Slippery road ahead. This warns that the road surface may be slippery.

text:
Where would you see a
contraflow bus lane?
explanation: Steep hill downwards. This indicates a steep descent ahead.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Steep hill upwards. This warns of a steep climb ahead.

text: What does a sign with a brown background show?
explanation: Road narrows on both sides. This warns the road gets narrower ahead.

text: What does this sign mean?
explanation: Road narrows on right. The road narrows from the right side ahead.

text:
What's the purpose of
triangular shaped signs?
explanation: Two-way traffic crosses one-way road. Traffic from both directions crosses your path.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Double bend ahead (first to left). This warns of two bends, first curving left.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Sharp deviation of route to the right. A sharp right turn ahead.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Level crossing with barrier ahead. This warns of a railway crossing with barriers.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Level crossing without barrier ahead. Railway crossing without barriers - extra care needed.

text:
What information would
be shown in a triangular
road sign?
explanation: Cattle on road ahead. Farm animals may be on the road.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Wild animals on road. Wild animals may cross or be on the road.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Risk of grounding. Low or uneven road surface where vehicles may bottom out.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Low-flying aircraft or sudden aircraft noise. Near airports where aircraft fly low.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Available width of headroom indicated. Shows maximum height clearance under bridge.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Ford ahead. Warns of a road crossing through water.

text:
What does this traffic
sign mean?
explanation: Soft verges. Road edges are soft and may not support vehicle weight.

text:
You're about to overtake.
What should you do when
you see this sign?

options.A: Move to the right to get a better view
options.B: Overtake the other driver as quickly as possible
options.C: Switch your headlights on before overtaking
options.D: Hold back until you can see clearly ahead

explanation: Side winds. Strong crosswinds likely, especially for high vehicles.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Level crossing without gate or barrier
options.D: Level crossing with gate or barrier

explanation: Hump bridge. Bridge with steep approach and limited visibility over the top.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Worded warning sign. Variable message board showing specific warnings.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Quayside or river bank. Road leads to waterside with no barrier.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Opening or swing bridge ahead. Bridge may open to allow boats through.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.B: No entry for traffic turning left
options.D: No through road on the left

explanation: Give way to oncoming vehicles. Oncoming traffic has priority in narrow section.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: No motor vehicles. All motor vehicles prohibited from entering.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: The right-hand lane ahead is narrow

explanation: No cycling. Pedal cycles are prohibited.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Lane for heavy and slow vehicles
options.B: All lorries use the hard shoulder

explanation: No goods vehicles over maximum gross weight shown. Heavy lorries prohibited.

text:
What does a red traffic
light mean?

options.B: You should stop unless turning left
options.C: Stop, if you're able to brake safely
options.D: You must stop and wait behind the stop line

explanation: No vehicles over height shown. Height restriction applies.

text:
At traffic lights, what
does it mean when the
amber light shows on its
own?

options.B: Go if no pedestrians are crossing
options.D: Go if the way is clear

explanation: No vehicles over width shown. Width restriction applies.

text:
You're at a junction 
controlled by traffic lights. When should you wait at a green light?

options.A: When you intend to turn right
options.B: When your exit from the junction is blocked
options.C: When pedestrians are waiting to cross
options.D: When you think the lights may be about to change

explanation: No vehicles over length shown. Length restriction applies.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: End of minimum speed limit. You no longer need to maintain the minimum speed.

text:
Who has priority when
traffic lights are out of
order?
explanation: School crossing patrol. Stop when the patrol signal is shown.

text:
What do these zigzag
white lines mean?

options.C: Parking allowed only for a short time

explanation: Give way to traffic on major road. Slow down and give priority to traffic on main road.

text:
When may you cross a
double solid white line in the
middle of the road?

options.A: To pass traffic that's queuing back at a junction
options.B: To pass a vehicle that's towing a trailer
options.C: To pass a road maintenance vehicle travelling at 10 mph or less
options.D: To pass a car signalling to turn left ahead

explanation: Manual temporary stop/go signs. Stop when red sign shown, go when green.

text: What does this road marking mean?
explanation: No waiting. You must not stop or park during times shown.

text:
Where would you see
this road marking?
explanation: No stopping. No stopping at any time, not even to set down passengers.

text:
Why does this junction
have a 'stop' sign and a stop
line on the road?

options.A: The junction is on a downhill gradient
options.C: Visibility along the major road is restricted
options.D: Speed on the major road is derestricted

explanation: Route direction sign. Green signs show primary route destinations.

text:
What does this line
across the road at the
entrance to a roundabout
mean?

options.C: Give way to traffic from the right
options.D: Traffic from the left has right of way

explanation: Local direction sign. White signs with black text show local destinations.

text:
How will a police officer
in a patrol vehicle signal for
you to stop?

options.A: Flash the headlights, indicate left and point to the left
options.B: Use the siren, overtake, cut in front and stop
options.C: Overtake and give a slowing down arm signal
options.D: Pull alongside you, use the siren and wave you to stop

explanation: Tourist attraction sign. Brown signs indicate tourist sites and attractions.

text:
You're approaching a 
junction where the traffic 
lights aren't working. What should you do when a police officer gives this signal?
explanation: Motorway service area. Shows services available at motorway service stations.

text:
What does this arm
signal mean?

options.B: The driver intends to turn left
options.D: The driver intends to turn right

explanation: Appropriate traffic lanes at junction ahead. Shows which lanes go where.

text:
What does this
motorway sign mean?

options.A: Pull up on the hard shoulder
options.B: Leave the motorway at the next exit
options.C: Change to the lane on your left

explanation: Ring road. Direction to ring road around a town or city.

text:
What does this
motorway sign mean?
explanation: Parking place. P sign indicates a parking area.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Through traffic to use left lane

explanation: Bus lane. Lane reserved for buses during times shown.

text:
What does '25' mean on
this motorway sign?

options.A: The number of the next junction
options.B: The distance to the nearest town
options.C: The route number of the road
options.D: The speed limit on the slip road

explanation: With-flow bus lane. Bus lane operating in same direction as other traffic.

text:
How should the right-
hand lane of a three-lane
motorway be used?
explanation: Contra-flow bus lane. Bus lane where buses travel opposite to other traffic.

text:
Where can you find
reflective amber studs on a
motorway?

options.A: On the right-hand edge of the road
options.B: Separating the slip road from the motorway
options.D: On the left-hand edge of the road

explanation: With-flow pedal cycle lane. Cycle lane in same direction as traffic.

text:
Where would you find
green reflective studs on a
motorway?

options.A: Between the hard shoulder and the carriageway
options.B: Between the carriageway and the central reservation

explanation: Route for pedal cycles. Dedicated cycle route.

text:
What should you do when you see this sign as you travel along a 
motorway?

options.B: Leave the motorway at the next exit

explanation: Pedestrian crossing point. Safe place for pedestrians to cross.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Hospital ahead with Accident and Emergency facilities. Shows route to A&E.

text:
What's the national
speed limit on a single
carriageway road?
explanation: Countdown markers to concealed level crossing. Shows distance to crossing.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Motorway start. Beginning of motorway regulations.

text:
What does this sign
indicate?
explanation: Motorway end. End of motorway - different rules apply beyond this point.

text:
What does this traffic
sign mean?
explanation: End of dual carriageway. Road becomes single carriageway ahead.

text:
What should you do
when you see this sign at a
crossroads?
explanation: One-way traffic. Traffic flows in one direction only.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Keep left. Traffic must pass to the left of this sign.

text:
You're on a motorway. A lorry has stopped in the 
right-hand lane. What should you do when you see this 
sign on the lorry?

options.C: Leave the motorway at the next exit
options.D: Pass the lorry on the left

explanation: Turn left ahead. You must turn left.

text:
You're on a motorway.
What should you do if 
there's a red cross showing on the signs above your 
lane only?

options.C: Stop and wait for an instruction to proceed
options.D: Continue in that lane and look for further information

explanation: Turn right ahead. You must turn right.

text:
When may you sound
your vehicle's horn?

options.A: To warn others of your presence
options.B: To give you right of way
options.D: To make slower drivers move over

explanation: Ahead only. You must proceed straight ahead.

text:
Your vehicle is
stationary. When may you
use its horn?

options.A: When another road user poses a danger
options.B: When signalling that you've just arrived
options.D: When the road is blocked by queuing traffic

explanation: Mini-roundabout. Give way to traffic from the right.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: End of the urban clearway restrictions
options.B: You can park on the days and times shown
options.C: No parking on the days and times shown
options.D: No parking at all from Monday to Friday

explanation: Priority over oncoming vehicles. You have priority in narrow section.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Parking restricted to permit holders. Only vehicles with permits may park.

text: What do the long white lines along the centre of the road mean?
explanation: Vehicles may park fully on the verge or footway. Where permitted, park entirely on pavement.

text:
What's the reason for the
hatched area along the
centre of this road?

options.A: It separates traffic flowing in opposite directions
options.B: It separates the two sides of the dual carriageway
options.C: It's a temporary marking to warn of the roadworks
options.D: It marks an area to be used by overtaking motorcyclists

explanation: Part of the carriageway parking. Park partly on pavement as shown.

text:
Other drivers may 
sometimes flash their 
headlights at you. What's the official meaning of this signal?

options.A: There's a radar speed trap ahead
options.B: They're warning you of their presence
options.C: There's a fault with your vehicle

explanation: Red route - no stopping. No stopping at any time on red routes.

text:
What does this signal
mean?

options.B: Both trams and cars must stop
options.C: Both trams and cars can continue

explanation: Parking on days and times shown. Parking restrictions apply during times displayed.

text:
Where would you find
these road markings?
explanation: Red route clearway Monday to Friday. No stopping Mon-Fri during times shown.

text: A police car is following you. What should you do if the police officer flashes the headlights and points to the left?

options.C: Turn left at the next junction

explanation: Only loading may take place. Loading and unloading only during times shown.

text:
You see this amber 
traffic light ahead. Which light, or lights, will come on next?
explanation: Urban clearway - no stopping. No stopping during times shown except for passengers.

text:
What does it mean if
you see this signal on the
motorway?

options.A: All vehicles use the hard shoulder
options.B: Sharp bend to the left ahead
options.D: Leave the motorway at the next exit

explanation: End of controlled parking zone. Parking restrictions no longer apply.

text:
What must you do when
you see this sign?

options.A: Stop only if a red light is showing
options.B: Stop only if children are waiting to cross
options.C: Stop even if the road is clear
options.D: Stop only if traffic is approaching

explanation: Red and white marker posts. Mark left edge of carriageway on motorways.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Green and white marker posts. Mark edge of primary routes.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.B: Two-way traffic crosses a one-way road
options.D: Two-way traffic crosses a two-way road

explanation: Hazard warning line. Single broken yellow line marks edge of carriageway.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.D: Two-way traffic crosses a one-way road

explanation: Reflective studs - red. Mark left edge of carriageway/hard shoulder on motorways.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Reflective studs - amber. Mark edge of central reservation on motorways.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: No parking for buses or coaches
options.B: Parking area for cars and coaches
options.D: Direction to bus and coach park

explanation: Reflective studs - white. Mark lane divisions on all roads.

text:
What should you do when you're approaching traffic lights that have red and amber showing 
together?

options.B: Stop because the lights are changing to red
options.C: Pass the lights if the road is clear
options.D: Take care because there's a fault with the lights

explanation: Stop line at traffic lights. Must stop if light is red.

text:
You've stopped at a 
railway level crossing. What should you do if the red 
lights continue to flash after a train has gone by?
explanation: Stop line at junction. Stop at this line before proceeding.

text:
You're in a tunnel and
you see this sign. What does
it mean?

options.A: Direction to an emergency pedestrian exit
options.B: Beware of pedestrians: no footpath ahead

explanation: Give way to traffic on major road. Triangle marks give way line.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.D: No waiting for buses and cycles

explanation: Lane divider. Broken white lines separate traffic lanes.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Loading bay. Yellow markings indicate loading zone.

text:
What should you be
aware of if you've just
passed this sign?

options.A: You can't stop on this road
options.C: All traffic is going one way
options.D: Only one lane is in use

explanation: School entrance marking. Keep entrance clear - 'SCHOOL KEEP CLEAR'.

text:
You're approaching
traffic lights and the red light
is showing. What signal will
show next?
explanation: Level crossing ahead. White diagonal stripes warn of crossing.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Cycle lane. Marked lane for cyclists.

text:
What does this white
arrow on the road mean?

options.C: Return to your side of the road

explanation: High occupancy vehicle lane. Lane for vehicles with multiple occupants.

text: You're waiting at a T-junction. What should you do if a vehicle is coming from the right, with its left indicator flashing?

options.A: Pull out before the vehicle reaches the junction
options.D: Wait until the vehicle starts to turn in

explanation: Disabled parking bay. Space reserved for Blue Badge holders.

text:
When may you use
hazard warning lights while
you're driving?

options.A: Instead of sounding the horn in a built-up area between 11.30 pm and 7.00 am
options.B: On a motorway or unrestricted dual carriageway, to warn of a hazard ahead
options.C: On the approach to toucan crossings, where cyclists are waiting to cross
options.D: On rural routes, after a sign warning of animals

explanation: Electric vehicle charging point. Parking for charging electric vehicles.

text:
Why should you make
sure that your indicators are
cancelled after turning at a
junction?

options.A: To avoid misleading other road users
options.B: To avoid dazzling other road users
options.C: To avoid damage to the indicator relay

explanation: Permit holder parking only. Only vehicles with permits may park.

text:
You're driving in busy traffic. You want to pull up just after a junction on the left. When should you 
signal?

options.A: Well before you reach the junction
options.B: Just before you reach the junction
options.C: It would be better not to signal at all
options.D: As you're passing or just after the junction

explanation: Maximum speed. The speed shown must not be exceeded.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Buses and pedal cycles should look right
options.B: Give way to buses and pedal cycles approaching from the right
options.C: No buses or pedal cycles allowed
options.D: Lookout for buses and pedal cycles approaching from the right

explanation: Minimum speed. You must drive at least this fast unless unsafe.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Advisory speed limit. Recommended speed for the conditions.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.B: Stopping place for local buses from 10am to 4pm

explanation: Variable speed limit. Speed limit changes based on conditions.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: All vehicles may stand at all times
options.B: All vehicles are prohibited during the times shown
options.C: Local Buses may stand during the times shown only
options.D: Local Buses may stand at all times

explanation: Lane closed ahead. Red X means lane is closed - do not use.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: No pedal cycles or pedestrians allowed
options.D: Shared route for pedal cycles and pedestrians only

explanation: Leave motorway at next exit. Follow emergency diversion route.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Temporary maximum speed. Variable speed limit on smart motorways.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Separated track and path for pedal cycles and pedestrians
options.B: Pedal cycles and pedestrians are prohibited
options.C: Shared route for pedal cycles and pedestrians only
options.D: Pedestrians must give way to pedal cycles

explanation: Move to lane shown. Overhead signs direct you to change lanes.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.C: Route for any vehicles except for pedal cycles

explanation: Fog warning. Amber lights warn of fog ahead.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.B: Pedal cycle route crossing or joining road ahead

explanation: Tunnel ahead. Sign warns of approaching tunnel.

text:
What does this yellow
panel indicate?
explanation: Congestion charging zone. Area where charge applies.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Waiting prohibited 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, for 4 consecutive months
options.B: Waiting prohibited 24 hours a day for only two days (1 May and 30 Sept)
options.C: Entry prohibited 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, for 4 consecutive months
options.D: Parking prohibited 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, for 4 consecutive months

explanation: Low emission zone. Area with vehicle emission restrictions.

text:
What does this sign tell
you?

options.A: Waiting prohibited between times shown on the sign
options.C: Driving prohibited at all times except for the times shown
options.D: Waiting prohibited at all times except for the times shown

explanation: Clean air zone. Area with air quality restrictions.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Advanced stop line for pedal cycles at traffic signals
options.B: Pedal cyclists to dismount at end of a cycle lane, track or route

explanation: Parking meter zone. Pay and display parking area.

text:
This sign tells you that
vehicles may be ____

options.A: parked partially on the verge or footway
options.B: parked wholly on the verge or footway

explanation: Resident permit parking. Only residents with permits may park.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Shared use path. Path for both pedestrians and cyclists.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: No entry for traffic, including pedal cycles
options.C: No motor vehicles except solo motorcycles
options.D: No vehicles except pedal cycles being pushed by hand

explanation: Segregated cycle track. Separate tracks for cyclists and pedestrians.

text:
What does this
motorway sign mean?
explanation: Cycle route ahead. Direction to cycle route.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Cycle parking. Designated area for parking bicycles.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Pedestrian zone. Area where only pedestrians are allowed.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Home zone entry. Residential area where pedestrians have priority.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Quiet lane. Rural road with low traffic.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Junctions with deceleration lanes and direction of slip roads
options.B: Exit slip road separates from the main carriageway
options.C: Lane ahead is closed and traffic should move to the next lane on the left
options.D: Appropriate lanes to use for turning movements at a junction ahead

explanation: Advisory route for lorries. Recommended route for heavy vehicles.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Weak bridge. Weight restriction on bridge.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.C: No traffic signals on this road

explanation: Distance to amenity. Shows distance to facility or service.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Parking guidance. Shows spaces available in car park.

text:
If you see alternatively
flashing red lights, what
must you do?

options.A: Continue driving because the lights aren't working properly
options.B: Call police immediately and report the faulty traffic light

explanation: Picnic site. Designated picnic area ahead.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Ancient monument. Historic site nearby.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Nature reserve. Protected wildlife area.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.C: Separated track and path for pedal cycles and pedestrians

explanation: Visitor attraction. Museum, theme park, or other attraction.

text:
What does this sign
show?

options.A: Temporary minimum distance between the vehicles

explanation: Zoo or wildlife park. Animal attraction nearby.

text:
You are coming up to a junction and see the 
following sign. What does it mean?
explanation: Sports facility. Stadium or sports venue.

text:
You are turning left at a
junction and see this sign.
What does it mean?

options.B: You are at a staggered junction

explanation: Camp site. Camping facility available.

text:
You are travelling on a
road and spot this sign.
What does it tell you?

options.B: There is a junction on a bend

explanation: Caravan site. Caravan and motorhome parking.

text:
Which sign can be used
together with this plate?
explanation: Emergency diversion route. Follow in case of road closure.

text:
What does the following
sign mean?
explanation: Temporary sign. Shows temporary traffic management.

text:
Whilst you are driving,
you spot this sign. What
does it tell you?
explanation: Road works sign. Advance warning of roadworks.

text:
What does this sign
warn you about?
explanation: Lane closure ahead. Shows which lanes will be closed.

text:
What does the following
sign mean?
explanation: Contraflow ahead. Temporary traffic system with opposing traffic.

text:
You are driving and see
this sign. What does it warn
you about?
explanation: Delays possible. Expect delays due to works or incident.

text:
What does the following
sign warn you about?
explanation: End of road works. Temporary restrictions no longer apply.

text:
You are driving and see
this sign. What does it warn
you about?
explanation: Traffic signal ahead. Temporary traffic lights at roadworks.

text:
You are driving about
and see this sign. What does
it tell you?
explanation: Loose chippings. Recently resurfaced road with loose stones.

text:
You come across the
following sign, what does it
mean?

options.B: Accompanied horses or ponies likely to be crossing the road
options.C: Horse-drawn vehicles likely to be on the road
options.D: Cattle grid with indication of bypass for horse-drawn vehicles and animals

explanation: Slow-moving or stationary queue. Warns of traffic ahead.

text:
You are travelling along
a road and spot this sign.
What does it tell you?

options.B: Double bend first to the right
options.D: Double bend first to the left

explanation: Police incident ahead. Police controlling traffic ahead.

text:
What does the following
sign mean?

options.D: No motor vehicles except solo motorcycles

explanation: Accident or incident ahead. Expect delays and changed conditions.

text:
You come across the
following sign, what does it
mean?

options.D: Accompanied horses or ponies likely to be crossing the road

explanation: Width restriction ahead at roadworks. Temporary narrow lanes.

text:
You are travelling along
a road and spot this sign.
What does it tell you?
explanation: Convoy working ahead. Slow-moving roadworks vehicles.

text:
You are travelling on a
road and spot this sign.
What does it tell you?

options.A: No vehicles over maximum width shown
options.B: No goods vehicles over maximum gross weight shown in tonnes
options.D: No vehicles or combinations of vehicles over maximum length shown

explanation: Road closed ahead. Find alternative route.

text:
You are driving about
and see this sign. What does
it tell you?

options.D: Vehicles may pass on either side

explanation: Use hard shoulder as running lane. Temporary use of hard shoulder.

text:
What does the following
sign mean?
explanation: Active traffic management. Variable message signs control traffic flow.

text:
You are driving and see
this sign. What does it tell
you?
explanation: Queue ahead. Slow or stopped traffic ahead.

text:
You are driving along a
road and see this sign. What
does this sign mean?
explanation: Reduced visibility ahead. Fog, spray or other visibility hazard.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: The national speed limit applies. The diagonal black stripe on white background indicates the national speed limit.

text:
You are driving along a
road and see this traffic
sign. What should you do?
explanation: Not exceed 40 mph. This is a 40 mph maximum speed limit sign.

text:
Where would you
usually see this road sign?

options.B: At the start of a tunnel
options.C: At the start of a motorway

explanation: At the start of a motorway. Blue signs with motorway symbols mark motorway starts.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Maximum speed permitted, in mph. The circular red border indicates a maximum speed limit in mph in the UK.

text:
What does this sign tell
you?
explanation: End of minimum speed requirement. This marks the end of a minimum speed limit.

text:
You are driving along a
road and see this sign. What
does it mean?

options.A: You are NOT allowed to take more than 30 photographs
options.C: There is a speed camera in 30 miles
options.D: Speed camera nearby on a road with a 30 mph speed limit

explanation: Speed camera nearby on a road with a 30 mph speed limit. This warns of speed cameras enforcing the 30 mph limit.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: End of use of speed cameras
options.B: Slow down before the speed camera

explanation: Enforcement cameras are in use. This warns drivers that speed cameras are operating in the area.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Start of a speed limit at the boundary of a town or village
options.C: End of a speed limit at the boundary of a town or village

explanation: Start of a speed limit at the boundary of a town or village. This indicates entering a 30 mph zone at town/village boundary.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Two cameras are in use to measure average speed
options.B: You are NOT allowed to take photographs
options.C: You are allowed to take photographs
options.D: Slow down before the speed camera

explanation: Two cameras are in use to measure average speed. Average speed cameras monitor speed over a distance.

text:
What does this sign tell
you?

options.A: No vehicles over the length shown may pass the sign
options.B: Only vehicles over the height shown may pass the sign
options.C: Any vehicles may pass the sign
options.D: No vehicles over the height shown may pass the sign

explanation: No vehicles over the height shown may pass the sign. Height restriction prohibits taller vehicles.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Height restriction ahead. This warns of low bridge or height limit ahead.

text:
What does this sign tell
you?

options.A: Trams crossing with a gate or barrier
options.B: Level crossing with a gate or barrier
options.C: Level crossing without a gate or barrier
options.D: Trams crossing without a gate or barrier

explanation: Level crossing with a gate or barrier. The gate symbol indicates barriers at the crossing.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.B: Level crossing with a gate or barrier
options.C: Level crossing without a gate or barrier

explanation: Level crossing without a gate or barrier. No barrier shown means unprotected crossing.

text:
Where would you
usually see this road sign?
explanation: Level crossing. Light signals are used at railway level crossings.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Electrified overhead cable. Warns of overhead electric cables, often for trams or trains.

text:
You're driving and see
bells ahead. What do these
bells warn you about?
explanation: Speed of vehicle. Bells at level crossings warn of trains approaching - slow down.

text: Long low vehicles may be at risk of _____
explanation: Grounding. Long, low vehicles risk getting stuck on uneven road surfaces like humped bridges.

text:
What do the sloping
bars on countdown markers
represent?
explanation: Distance. Each bar represents 100 yards to the level crossing.

text:
You are a pedestrian at
a level crossing. What does
this flashing pedestrian
signal indicate?

options.A: It is not safe to cross
options.D: One pedestrian should cross at a time

explanation: It is not safe to cross. Flashing lights at level crossings mean do not cross - train approaching.

text:
What vehicles should
park here to contact the
signal operator?
explanation: Large or slow vehicles. These vehicles should phone before crossing to get permission.

text:
The St Andrew’s cross
is used at level crossings
where _____

options.A: there are no gates or barriers

explanation: there are no gates or barriers. St Andrew's cross (X) is used at unprotected crossings.

text:
What must you do when
you see this sign?
explanation: Stop. This is a stop sign - you must stop completely before proceeding.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Report the location of trams to police officers
options.C: Lookout for trams approaching from both directions

explanation: Give way to trams. You must give priority to trams in this area.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Trams crossing the road ahead. Warns that trams cross the road at this point.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: No large vehicles. Vehicles exceeding the maximum gross weight are prohibited.

text:
What does this sign
mean?
explanation: Buses and pedal cycles only. This lane is reserved for buses and cycles.

text:
What does this sign
mean?

options.A: Parking place for buses only (with time limit)
options.C: Parking place for buses only (no time limit)
options.D: Parking place for all vehicles (with time limit)

explanation: Parking place for buses only (with time limit). Parking restricted to buses during times shown.

text:
You are on a red route. What does a single red line on the side of the road 
mean?

options.C: No parking, but loading is permitted
options.D: No stopping except for passenger pickup or drop-off

explanation: No stopping at times shown. Single red line means no stopping during the times displayed.
